sentences.english: In the most lofty devotion we become unconscious of self.
sentences.chinese: 在最崇高的灵修中，我们变得浑然不觉自我。

sentences.english: We should have known that we are living in the subtle happiness surroundings every day.
sentences.chinese: 其实，我们每天生活在小幸福之中，只是浑然不觉。

sentences.english: The basis of spycraft is breaking the rules without being noticed.
sentences.chinese: 间谍活动的基要就是在对方浑然不觉时打破规则。

sentences.english: Seldom affected by the environment, seldom aware of things happening around him.
sentences.chinese: 很少受外界影响，对身边发生的事情浑然不觉。

sentences.english: Sometimes not even the marriage partner is aware.
sentences.chinese: 有时甚至婚礼上的伴侣都浑然不觉。

definition: to be totally oblivious (to sth)/to have no idea about sth
to turn a blind eye to
to block one's ears and not listen (idiom); to turn a deaf ear
to not mind (at all, a bit)/to not care in the slightest
unable to take one's eyes off (idiom); to gaze steadily/to stare
to not say a word (idiom)/to keep silent
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to not know the reason/to not know what to do
